Wyatt Earp, although often erroneously regarded as the central figure, was unharmed. The gunfight did not actually happen in the corral, but in a vacant lot outside of it. The shooting started when Billy Clanton and Frank McLaury cocked their pistols, and both parties simultaneously drew their guns.
